reason: To improve text mode file handling and provide support for specifying encodings when opening files.
Several enhancements were made to improve consistency and functionality when sending files, such as replacing `attachment_filename` with `download_name` and other interface improvements.
MIME guessing and etag support for file-like objects was removed because it was unreliable. Explicit filename needs to be passed to restore support.

replaced_by: flask command line script's run support
reason: Using the Flask.run() function for development automatic reloading is inefficient and not recommended. Developers are encouraged to use the flask CLI tool instead.
The default configuration is changed to `None` to indicate better browser caching behavior using conditional requests rather than timed caching.
Starting in version 2.1, the `Request.get_json` method raises a `400 Bad Request` error when the content type is incorrect. This ensures stricter compliance with JSON request standards.
Changed the default configuration to improve cache handling by default, better align with modern web caching practices.
Enhanced functionality to allow opening resource files relative to an application's instance folder for greater flexibility.
The default configuration for max_age was changed from 12 hours to None to encourage more conditional caching.
The API was moved to `current_app.make_response` to enhance configurability and allow apps to override behavior.
Encourage the use of Flask command-line interface (CLI) for starting applications, which provides better integration and improved workflow.
Changed behavior to prevent SERVER_NAME from restricting requests to only the specified domain for subdomain_matching and host_matching.
To allow specifying the encoding when opening resources in text mode for greater flexibility.
To handle cases where view functions do not directly return a response object but additional headers need to be included in the response.
Improved clarity and alignment with HTTP standards for parameter naming and response handling.
Starting from version 1.0, SERVER_NAME no longer implicitly enables subdomain matching. Developers should explicitly use the subdomain_matching parameter.
Refactored to encourage the use of the CLI for better flexibility and standardization.
Changed default behavior to improve cache handling by setting the default configuration to None instead of 12 hours.
SERVER_NAME no longer implicitly enables subdomain matching due to concerns about ambiguous behavior. Subdomain matching must now be explicitly enabled with the subdomain_matching parameter.
To add support for explicitly specifying the file encoding for text-mode reads, improving interoperability with encoding-sensitive applications.
SERVER_NAME no longer implicitly enables subdomain matching. Use subdomain_matching instead.
send_file was updated to move some security checks and path validations to Werkzeug. send_from_directory was introduced for safely sending files from directories provided by user input.

The `Flask.run` method is discouraged for development with automatic reloading and debugging as it is poorly supported. Flask CLI provides better integration and reliability for managing development servers.
The `open_resource` function was updated in version 3.1 to introduce an `encoding` parameter for additional file handling flexibility.
The `encoding` parameter was added to provide flexibility in text mode file operations, enabling support for different encodings.

The CLI runner no longer supports passing the parameter `app` to serialize or deserialize JSON data. Parameters must now be exclusively passed within app contexts or removed per direct configuration adjustments.
